title: Cards for trade (for land in MI)--Cobb, Ruth, Wagner, Plank, Gehrig, etc.
author: t206madman

posts.post_title: Cards for trade (for land in MI)--Cobb, Ruth, Wagner, Plank, Gehrig, etc.

posts.post_content: If you had the T206 Wagner in the lot, you might be able to trade for the whole upper peninsula and half the Mackinac Bridge.:D
None of my business I guess but wouldn't it be more realistic to trade the cards for money and then trade the money for land?

You've got a great collection here, which would net quite a bit on auction these days! Just to continue to play devil's advocate, I am willing to bet good money that the choice of properties in the hands of those who value vintage baseball cards is far more limited than the choice of properties in the hands of those who value dollars :D Wish I could help out!

Musical interlude

Just give me land, lots of land, under starry skies above
Don't fence me in
Let me ride through the wide open country that I love
Don't fence me in

:)
Fill soil runs about $20/cubic yard in Livonia. Plus delivery fee.  How about I send you 6 yards of fill soil for your T200 Washington card?

This has the potential to be the strangest thread in the history of Net 54...and that's saying something.

Best of luck, t206madman.

[quote name="Eric72" post=1764414]This has the potential to be the strangest thread in the history of Net 54...and that's saying something.

Best of luck, t206madman.[/QUOTE]

Peter Chao and Virginia Tech will never be topped.

I see some cards on those lists that I would trade money for . Just sayin’


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

I think it would be safer to sell cards to some of the good people on this board than to trade cards for land. Besides, it's a needle in a haystack that someone has the plot of land you want and at the same time wants to own those exact cards. But it's not hard to buy land with cash. Just my three cents.
How about a small cottage in Flint Michigan complete with the old lead water pipes?
Any interest in selling them? Would be interested in Evers (Cubs on shirt) and Tinker (bat off shoulder).

I have 4.96 acres in Florissant, CO. I'm asking $37,000.
Looking directly east at Pike's Peak from the land, 50 miles as the crow flies. :)

[quote name="barrysloate" post=1764641]I think it would be safer to sell cards to some of the good people on this board than to trade cards for land. Besides, it's a needle in a haystack that someone has the plot of land you want and at the same time wants to own those exact cards. But it's not hard to buy land with cash. Just my three cents.[/QUOTE]

+1

Interesting concept, but I think it’ll be a near impossible fit. Sell the cards, and buy some land. Either way, best of luck.

[quote name="t206madman" post=1764844]At the moment I don't have interest in selling the cards.  I want to wait and see what kind of land offers may come my way for something around Lansing, Michigan or within a couple hours.  I'm not in a hurry to make a decision.  

Thank you all for the interest, I will keep everyone in mind that has messaged me.  I don't really know what's so strange about this offer, it's just another trade for assets, same as someone asking to trade a Ty Cobb for a Babe Ruth.  He can obviously sell the Ty Cobb and go buy a Ruth, but it's also fun and rewarding to wait and see what you may be offered.  I would be honored to have the strangest post here.[/QUOTE]

The concept isn't strange..but the chances of someone on this board having land for sale in that area are extremely low.  By selling the cards, you would at least have the cash on hand to go towards any plot of land you wanted.  Regardless, good luck on your search and your card collection is very nice.
Any interest in a 450 sq ft studio in yonkers?

[quote name="ronniehatesjazz" post=1802027]Any interest in a 450 sq ft studio in yonkers?[/QUOTE]

Is it on the Hudson!!?? :D
PM sent.
I have land in Wisconsin only a stone's throw from the UP if you have a strong arm.

[quote name="T206Collector" post=1802041]Is it on the Hudson!!?? :D[/QUOTE]

Sadly it's not. On the bright side, it's in a nice secluded alley right around the corner from a Little Caesar's!
Are you looking for the land to be in lower Michigan or in the upper peninsula?
